audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing himself as "Pierce the Veil" and mentioning they are at the "Pure Volume headquarters in Hollywood, California." He says they are there to answer fan questions. The clip then transitions to a sound effect: a whooshing noise immediately followed by a cartoonish-sounding impact or explosion. Finally, one of the speakers says "You ready?" and another agrees.

The audio clip begins with two speakers, one a male asking a question about wishing one had written a particular song, then asking what song that would be. The first male speaker answers with “It’s raining men," speaking in a straightforward tone. The other male agrees, stating "such a good song" then indicating it is next level and he will play it at his wedding. A brief moment of silence, then the second male speaker volunteers, "I think I'm going to go with" followed by "Whitney Houston, I want to dance with somebody." The first male responds it’s a great song, then notes that any party with that song will succeed and that the song makes everyone dance. The second male speaker agrees, with an additional comment of "girls just want to have fun does pretty good too" and the first speaker saying "okay" and agreeing. The second male speaker would then choose "MJ Thriller," and the speaker comments of the greatness of that choice. The clip concludes with conversational, amicable speech.

The clip starts with a male speaker asking about a potential collaboration with Kellen Quinn, to which another male responds that "you never know," that "anything could happen." The first male then adds the phrase "if it's not broken, don't fix it," followed by another response that "it works before, why not do it again?". The speaker then proposes doing some more questions. There is background music. The music is upbeat, and contains pop or rock elements, possibly drums. The clip ends with the sound of the first male speaker asking another question, "coming from a Mexican culture, ah yes."

The audio clip begins with one male speaker asking how his parents reacted to his decisions to be in a band, get tattoos, and get piercings, noting that his parents never understood his music taste or approved of tattoos and piercings. Another male speaker responds, presumably beginning his answer. The background ambiance consists of music playing.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker mentioning that his "parents are really supportive of the music" he's involved in. He then shares a story about his mother's reaction to his tattoos, noting her initial disappointment followed by indifference. The speaker then trails off, and the clip ends.

The audio clip features two male speakers discussing tattoos and their mothers' reactions. The first speaker describes his mother's strong initial disapproval of his first tattoo. Then, the second speaker points out their shared brotherhood and mentions his mother has several tattoos herself. The first speaker clarifies that her tattoos are in more hidden locations compared to his visible one. He adds that his mother became supportive once she saw the band he was in gaining traction and attention. Throughout the conversation, a light rock musical backdrop can be heard.

The audio clip features a single male speaker recounting a story about his mother's changing attitude towards his tattoos. He describes how she initially "flipped" out and was very upset, even nearly hitting him, due to her dislike of tattoos. He then says he began to hide them from her. Later, he reveals how she had an abrupt change of heart when she got a tattoo herself, making him exclaim, "You freaking hypocrite, as he spoke with amusement and incredulity. During the speech, there's light background music, and at times the music fades, becoming more prominent in between phrases. The music is ambient.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker reading a question from an unknown source. The speaker asks when another album will be released. A second male speaker responds humorously. The first speaker then reads another question about the band's favorite song from a record and why. He answers his favorite is a song because it is fun to play and the fans are emotional while singing along. The second speaker interrupts agreeing to liking a song because it is played acoustically rather than in the record. The first speaker continues agreeing, referencing the difference between the full band and the acoustic version. A third male speaker suggests another song, referring to the meaning behind it. The second speaker says it is about like overcoming cancer and something else. Finally, the first speaker says he will read a new question.

The audio clip begins with light, upbeat background music, and two male speakers engage in conversation. One speaker mentions, "Hannah Smith wants to know what high school was like for us," and the other responds about a person who was "next level." They proceed to talk about someone being a "sponsored yo-yo player," followed by laughter and then comments about dressing in "liberty spikes and plaid pants," suggesting a unique personal style. The music fades as the conversation progresses, and then there is a distinct sound effect described as "crazy sounds," which ends the clip.

The audio starts with a male speaker describing himself as "shy and quiet." Then a male speaker jokes about someone eating faces. There's more talk about someone's name. One male speaker then asks what someone's worst birthday gift was. After some silence and a nervous laugh, he recalls birthdays spent driving through the Midwest, with a sarcastic "Happy Birthday!" comment. There's talk about a shot called the "Three Wise Men," made with Jim, Jack, and Jose mixed. Then one person recounts receiving a Ricky Martin knockoff shirt from his Mexican grandma, who thought it was a great gift because he lives a "crazy life." He said everyone laughed.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker reminiscing about a past Christmas, recalling how he accidentally cut the cords of his brother's toy drumsticks, ruining the gift. His tone is casual and narrative. Suddenly, this is interrupted by an intense, high-pitched electronic sound resembling a screech.
